item.description:
Let's meet up for a last evening of FREE classical music for the season!

Hi Folks,

Although the final official symphony concert is next Wednesday, I found out that there's a Friday evening concert where 2 conducting students will be conducting the newly formed NEC "lab orchestra" in performing Debussy, Strauss, Bartok, and finally, Beethoven's 5th Symphony.

A similar concert last December was loved by all who attended, and the same 2 students will be conducting. I must hear the 5th, so I'm going, even though it's short notice, and I hope some of you will join me!

The concert will be held in Brown Hall, located in the same building as Jordan Hall, but to get there, you go in the main entrance, them turn to the right and go down the hall, around the corner and downstairs. For more details about the concert, go to http://www.necmusic.e...

The Friday concert starts at 8:30pm, but let's meet up at 8:00, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize a bit before the concert. Brown hall is much smaller than Jordan, so get there on time to be assured of a seat! I'll try to gather us in the lobby upstairs until about 8:10 or so, and then head down as a group this time.

Directions to Brown Hall:
The hall is located downstairs in the same building as Jordan Hall, at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.


This evening's program will include:


  • Debussy Prelude to the Afternoon of a Faun (Listen here)
  • Strauss Overture to Die Fledermaus (Listen here)
  • Bart√≥k Dance Suite (Listen two the 2nd movement here)
  • Beethoven: Symphony no. 5 (listen to the classic 1st movement here)
item.how_to_find_us: Will will stand in the lobby until 8:10, after which he will take the gathered group to the hall.
item.name: Last minute concert: Lab Orchestra Conducting Concert (Beethoven 5th +)
